data.title: Colorado State University
data.meta_description: Patrick Cartier (12) Forward - Awards and Honors First Team Division II All-American (2022) Second Team Division II All-American (2021) Great Midwest Athleti...
data.text:
Awards and Honors

First Team Division II All-American (2022)

Second Team Division II All-American (2021)

Great Midwest Athletic Conference Player of the Year (2021, 2022)

Great Midwest Athletic Conference Freshman of the Year (2020)

First Team All-G-MAC (2020, 2021, 2022)

At Colorado State

Senior (2022-23)

Played in all 33 games, starting in 21.

His 64.7% field goal shooting ranked as the sixth-best single-season mark in program history.

Surpassed the 2,000 career scoring mark against New Mexico (Mar. 3).

Scored 20-plus points three times.

The team’s third-leading scorer with 12.3 points per game.

Made a career-best three 3-pointers against Northern Colorado (Dec. 3) on his way to a 23-point performance.

Prior to Colorado State

Played three seasons at Hillsdale (MI) College.

Scored 1,624 points, the seventh most in program history and set the program’s field goal percentage mark at 65.2%.

Two-time consensus Division II All-American and Great Midwest Athletic Conference (G-MAC) Player of the Year).

Led the Chargers to their first-ever NCAA Regional title and NCAA Elite Eight in 2021-22.

Averaged 22.0 points, 6.1 rebounds, 2.4 assists while shooting 66.0% in 2021-22 on his way to a first team All-America selection.

Led the G-MAC in scoring with 20.5 points per game and shot 65.1% as a junior.

Helped Hillsdale to their first G-MAC regular season title as a freshman.

Personal/High School

Three-sport athlete at Brookfield East High School, playing basketball, football and track and field.

Helped the Spartan’s to a 25-4 record his senior season after going 4-20 as a sophomore.

Second team American Family Insurance All-USA Wisconsin team member

Conference Player of the Year as a senior

Milwaukee Journal Sentinel All-Suburban Boys’ Basketball team selection

Led his team to a state runner-up finish in the WIAA Division I State Tournament.
